cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi ESE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest along the Florida east coast today, then turning north-northwest and accelerating parallel to the southeast U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the east-central Florida coast between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral (may brush the shoreline rather than an inland landfall)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Hallandale Beach FL to South Santee River SC, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: entire southeast Florida coastline, expanding northward along Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (forecast 2–4 ft for Jupiter Inlet area)
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–65 mph) with higher gusts likely Sunday into Sunday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal water rise of 2–4 ft above ground level possible near the port at times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches expected with isolated totals up to 6 inches, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; port operations may face wave overtopping and minor coastal flooding
